org.sd.xml
Class XmlLite

java.lang.Object
  org.sd.xml.XmlLite

public class XmlLite
extends java.lang.Object

Read in xml as a tree, discarding all comments and normalizing all text.

Author:
Spence Koehler

getTop

public Tree<XmlLite.Data> getTop(XmlInputStream inputStream)
                          throws java.io.IOException
Read the next (top) xml node, without reading its children.

This is intended as a mechanism to use for incremental parsing of an xml stream that is too large to fit in memory all at once. Once the top has been read, each child can be read, one at a time, using getNextChild.

NOTE: comments will be ignored regardless of this instance's setting.

Throws:
java.io.IOException

getNextChild

public Tree<XmlLite.Data> getNextChild(XmlInputStream inputStream)
                                throws java.io.IOException
Read the next xml node.

This is intended as a mechanism to use for incremental parsing of an xml stream that is too large to fit in memory all at once. Typically, this is called after a call to getTop. NOTE: comments will be ignored regardless of this instance's setting.

Throws:
java.io.IOException

getNextChild

public Tree<XmlLite.Data> getNextChild(XmlInputStream inputStream,
                                       Tree<XmlLite.Data> altTopNode)
                                throws java.io.IOException
Read the next xml node.

This is intended as a mechanism to use for incremental parsing of an xml stream that is too large to fit in memory all at once. Typically, this is called after a call to getTop.

Usually altTopNode will be null; but if it isn't, it is used as the root of the child being read. NOTE: comments will be ignored regardless of this instance's setting.

Throws:
java.io.IOException
